criteria: Understanding of Condom Effectiveness in Preventing HIV/STDs
Understanding of Condom Effectiveness in Preventing Pregnancy
Ability to Compare and Contrast Effectiveness
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of how condoms prevent HIV/STDs or provides inaccurate information.
Student demonstrates a minimal understanding of how condoms prevent HIV/STDs with significant gaps or inaccuracies.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of how condoms prevent HIV/STDs, but explanations are incomplete or contain minor inaccuracies.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of how condoms prevent HIV/STDs with mostly accurate explanations.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of how condoms prevent HIV/STDs, providing accurate and reasonably detailed explanations.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive and nuanced understanding of how condoms prevent HIV/STDs, providing accurate, detailed, and insightful explanations.
Student demonstrates no understanding of how condoms prevent pregnancy or provides inaccurate information.
Student demonstrates a minimal understanding of how condoms prevent pregnancy with significant gaps or inaccuracies.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of how condoms prevent pregnancy, but explanations are incomplete or contain minor inaccuracies.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of how condoms prevent pregnancy with mostly accurate explanations.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of how condoms prevent pregnancy, providing accurate and reasonably detailed explanations.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive and nuanced understanding of how condoms prevent pregnancy, providing accurate, detailed, and insightful explanations.
Student shows no awareness or provides misinformation about other FDA-approved contraceptive methods.
Student names one or two other contraceptive methods but shows limited understanding or has inaccuracies.
Student identifies a few other contraceptive methods with some understanding, but explanations lack detail or have minor inaccuracies.
Student identifies several other contraceptive methods and demonstrates a general understanding of their purpose.
Student discusses multiple contraceptive methods, describing their mechanisms and effectiveness with reasonable accuracy and detail.
Student provides a comprehensive overview of various contraceptive methods, including detailed explanations of their mechanisms, effectiveness, and potential side effects or considerations.
Student cannot compare or contrast the effectiveness of different contraceptive methods.
Student attempts to compare/contrast but provides inaccurate or very limited information.
Student offers a superficial comparison/contrast of contraceptive methods with some inaccuracies or omissions.
Student provides a satisfactory comparison/contrast of the effectiveness of different contraceptive methods.
Student provides a strong comparison/contrast of different methods, accurately highlighting the strengths and weaknesses of each.

Student demonstrates a sophisticated ability to compare/contrast the effectiveness of different methods, including a nuanced understanding of factors influencing their efficacy in real-world scenarios.
